pullRequest.title: Sb fix doc generated for exclude include filter properties
pullRequest.bodyText:
Possible approach to making the doc for properties whose value is used in an ExcludeInclude filter. So far, only applied to maven scopes.
The main dilemma is related to the construction of an ExcludeInclude filter from List; the only constructor on the filter class expects a comma-separated String (which it then converts to a Set). The current code converts the lists to comma-separated strings before calling the constructor, that it that code will get repeated in several places. Other options include creating a new filter factory method (probably a new class), or modifying integration-common to add a new constructor. The latter definitely seems cleanest; I think the question is whether it's worth it.

commit.message: style(help): fix generated doc for ExcludeInclude lists; have only done maven scopes so far
refactor: eliminated the ExcludedIncludedWildcardFilterFactor... didn't see worth the cost

nodes.bodyText: I know it doesn't currently allow it, but we should be allowed to create ExcludedIncludedWildcardFilter with already created sets/lists. This seems a little silly.

commit.message: refactor: Added TODO for an INTCMN ticket.

fix: expanded exclude/include property type/doc fix to cover detect.gradle.excluded.configurations, detect.gradle.excluded.projects, detect.gradle.included.configurations, detect.gradle.included.projects, detect.maven.excluded.modules, detect.maven.included.modules, detect.maven.included.scopes, detect.maven.excluded.scopes, detect.nuget.excluded.modules, detect.nuget.included.modules, detect.sbt.excluded.configurations, detect.sbt.included.configurations
